shop.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a building or part of a building where you can buy things, food, or services
shop.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Shirley saw her reflection in the shop window.
I’m just going down to the shops.
Her brother runs a record shop in Chester.
I spent a happy afternoon wandering around the shops.
New potatoes are in the shops now.
shop.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a place where something is made or repaired
shop.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The generators are put together in the machine shop.
shop.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a subject taught in schools that shows students how to use tools and machinery to make or repair things
shop.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: One auto shop class is run just for girls.
Doug made this table in shop.
shop.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: an occasion when you go shopping, especially for food and other things you need regularly
shop.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: She always does the weekly shop on a Friday.
shop.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: shop
a building or place where things are sold
She's gone to the shops to get some milk.
a clothes shop
Our local store has sold out of sugar for making jam.
boutique
a small shop that sells fashionable clothes or other objects
a little boutique which specializes in bath products.
superstore
a very large shop, especially one that is built outside the centre of a city
Out-of-town superstores have taken business away from shops in the city centre.
department store
a very large shop that is divided into several big parts, each of which sells one type of thing, such as clothes, furniture, or kitchen equipment
He went around all the big department stores in Oxford Street.
supermarket
a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes
Supermarkets have cut down the number of plastic bags they distribute by 50%.
salon
a shop where you can get your hair washed, cut curled etc
garden centre
a place that sells a wide range of plants, seeds, and things for your garden
Your local garden centre can advise you on which plants to grow.
outlet
a shop that sells things for less than the usual price, especially things from a particular company or things of a particular type
The book is available from most retail outlets.
market
an area, usually outdoors, where people buy and sell many different types of things
I usually buy our vegetables at the market – they're much cheaper there.
mall
a large area where there are a lot of shops, especially a large building
A new restaurant has opened at the mall.
We used to hang around together at the mall.
strip mall
a row of shops built together, with a large area for parking cars in front of it
Strip malls can seem rather impersonal.
shop.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to go to one or more shops to buy things
shop.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I usually shop for vegetables in the market.
shop.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to tell the police about someone who has done something illegal
shop.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He was shopped by his ex-wife.
shop.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a building or part of a building where goods are sold to the public
shop.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a place where things are made or repaired
shop.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Firms can get grants to set up shop in the area.
shop.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: to talk about things that are connected to your work, especially in a way that other people find boring
shop.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: a group of salespeople talking shop
shop.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to go to one or more shops to buy things
shop.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: She went down town to shop for groceries.
Almost two-thirds of Americans shop at a convenience store at least once a week.
shop.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to go to one or more shops to buy things, usually clothes, for enjoyment
shop.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Young kids don’t have the money, but they go shopping with Mom.
